requirements: After MATH 225, 231, or 222, with additional experience writing mathematical proofs.
description:
Group theory, structure of Abelian groups, and applications to number theory. Symmetric groups and linear groups including orthogonal and unitary groups; properties of Euclidean and Hermitian spaces. Some examples of group representations. Modules over Euclidean rings, Jordan and rational canonical forms of a linear transformation.
After MATH 225, 231, or 222, with additional experience writing mathematical proofs.
title: Introduction to Abstract Algebra
extra_flags:
• YC Mathematics: Core Algebra
  • YC Math: Algebra/Number Theory
